channel.title: Comments on: Cleaning up those funny characters on an XML web service result
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: CM
item.dc:creator: CM
item.description: Just repeating the thanks -- very helpful!

item.title: By: Carolyn
item.dc:creator: Carolyn
item.description: Thanks so much - this helped me "parse the unparceable feed"!
item.content:encoded: Thanks so much – this helped me “parse the unparceable feed”!

item.title: By: George

item.description: THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOUTHANK YOU!!!!! You are awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!
item.content:encoded: THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOUTHANK YOU!!!!! You are awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: By: Kevin R.
item.dc:creator: Kevin R.
item.description:
Hello,
I ran into this exact issue when parsing XML returned from a QuarkXpress Server 'deconstruct' (it returns a XML document with all of the data used in conjunction with the referenced Quark file).
I kept thinking it was my code, but it all worked perfectly with other XML documents.
I used your fix and life was good!
Best regards, Kevin R. www.MyOwnLabels.com
item.content:encoded:
Hello,

I ran into this exact issue when parsing XML returned from a QuarkXpress Server ‘deconstruct’ (it returns a XML document with all of the data used in conjunction with the referenced Quark file).

I kept thinking it was my code, but it all worked perfectly with other XML documents.

I used your fix and life was good!

Best regards,
Kevin R.
http://www.MyOwnLabels.com/

item.title: By: mark kruger

item.description: Ryan, awesome stuff. You do a great job of organizing and sequencing information.
item.content:encoded: Ryan, awesome stuff. You do a great job of organizing and sequencing information.
